Html:
I've just completed my compiler for the Shakespeare programming language (using Irony)

Details on my blog: http://honestillusion.com/blog/2013/09/12/Shakespeare-compiler-for-NET/

Source code: https://github.com/jamescurran/ShakespeareCompiler

It has a grammar/parser, and three different back-ends (producing C source, C# source code, and a .NET exe directly), plus a command-line interface for running the whole process.

Feel free to add any part of it to the samples.

(Also, if someone who knows how to create a back-end code generator wants to look at my code and say if I'm doing it right, that would be great)

Great! I put a link to this post on Home page
Roman
